dustmaker package¶

Submodules¶

dustmaker.Map class¶

class Map(*, parent: Optional[dustmaker.level_map.Map] = None)¶

Bases: object

Represents a Dustforce map/level or the backdrop to another map/level. If this is a backdrop then parent will be set to the parent Map object.

Parameters

parent (Map, optional) – If this Map represents a backdrop this is the containing map. Typical usage should not need to use this parameter.

parent¶

For backdrops this is the containing map Otherwise this is set to None.

Type

Map, optional

backdrop¶

The backdrop Map object or None if this is a backdrop map. Backdrop maps are scaled up 16x from the parent Map’s coordinate system and should only contain tiles and props.

Type

Map, optional

tiles¶

A dict mapping (layer, x, y) to Tile objects.

Type

dict[(int, int, int), Tile]

props¶

A dict mapping prop ids to (layer, x, y, Prop) tuples.

Type

dict[int, (int, float, float, Prop)]

entities¶

A dict mapping entity ids to (x, y, Entity) tuples.

Type

dict[int, (float, float, Entity)]

variables¶

A raw mapping of string keys to Variable objects. Some of these variables have nicer accessor properties like name but may be accessed raw through this dictionary.

Type

dict[str, Variable]

sshot¶

The level thumbnail image as a PNG binary.

Type

bytes

add_entity(x: float, y: float, entity: dustmaker.entity.Entity, id_num: Optional[int] = None) → int¶

Adds a new entity to the map and returns its id.

x - The x position in tile units of the entity. y - The y position in tile units of the entity. entity - The Entity object to add to the map. id_num - The entity identifier. If set to None the identifier will be

allocated for you.

Raises a MapException if the given id is already in use.

add_prop(layer: int, x: float, y: float, prop: dustmaker.prop.Prop, id_num: Optional[int] = None) → int¶

Adds a new prop to the map and returns its id.

x - The x position in tile units of the prop. y - The y position in tile units of the prop. prop - The Prop object to add to the map. id_num - The prop identifier. If set to None the identifier will be

allocated for you.

Raises a MapException if the given id is already in use.

property dustmod_version: dustmaker.entity.T¶

property ‘dustmod_version’

flip_horizontal() → None¶

Flips the map horizontally.

flip_vertical() → None¶

Flips the map vertically.

property level_type: dustmaker.entity.T¶

level type of the map (see LevelType enum)

merge_map(other_map, _do_remap_ids=True)¶

Merge a map into this one.

map - The Map to merge into this one.

property name: dustmaker.entity.T¶

property ‘level_name’

remap_ids(min_id: Optional[int] = None)¶

Remap prop and entity ids starting at min_id.

This calls through to all entities to remap any references to other entity ids.

rotate(times: int = 1) → None¶

Rotates the map 90 degrees times times.

times - The number of 90 degree rotations to perform. This can be negative.

start_position(player: int = 1) → dustmaker.level_map.PlayerPosition¶

Returns a player position class that can access/modify the position through ‘x’ and ‘y’ properties

transform(mat: List[List[float]]) → None¶

Transforms the map with the given affine transformation matrix. Note that this will probably not produce desirable results if the transformation matrix is not some mixture of a translation, flip, and 90 degree rotations.

In most cases you should not use this method directly and instead use Map.flip_horizontal(), Map.flip_vertical(), or Map.rotate().

mat - The affine transformation matrix. [x’, y’, 1]’ = mat * [x, y, 1]’

translate(x: float, y: float) → None¶

Translate the entire map x pixels laterally and y pixels horizontally.

x - The number of pixels to move laterally. y - The number of pixels to move horizontally.

upscale(factor: int, *, mat: Optional[List[List[float]]] = None) → None¶

Increase the size of the map along each axis by factor.

mat - Optionally apply an additional transform. The transform will be

applied logically after the upscale.

property virtual_character: dustmaker.entity.T¶

property ‘vector_character’

dustmaker.variable module¶

Module defining the Dustforce variable representation

class Variable(value: Any)¶

Bases: object

Represents a variable attached to a Dustforce object.

assert_types() → None¶

Checks if the value type matches the variable type.

Raises

ValueError – value type and variable type do not agree

class VariableArray(element_type: Type[dustmaker.variable.Variable], values: Optional[List[dustmaker.variable.Variable]] = None)¶

Bases: dustmaker.variable.Variable

array variable

append(x)¶

Wrapper around list.append of the value

clear()¶

Forwards to clear on the underlying array

element_type() → Type[dustmaker.variable.Variable]¶

Returns the element type of this array.

pop(i=- 1)¶

Wrapper around list.pop of the value
